decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed Loft Conversion with a Side Dormer Window Roof Extension, by reason of its scale, size and appearance would be detrimental to the character and appearance of the existing dwelling and the Wimbledon West Conservation Area. The proposal would be therefore contrary to policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021, Policies DM D2, DM D3 and DM D4 of the Merton's Sites and Polices Plan (2014) and policy CS 14 of the Merton LDF Core Planning Strategy (2011) and the National Planning Policy Framework 2024.

Reason : 2 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF 2024  as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 
"	The application was considered to be fundamentally contrary to the provisions of the Development Plan and the NPPF 2024, and there were not considered to be any solutions to resolve this conflict. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
description: APPLICATION FOR A LOFT CONVERSION WITH A SIDE DORMER WINDOW ROOF EXTENSION WITH 1 ROOFLIGHT IN THE FRONT ROOF SLOPE .
